uk.ac.ebi.gxa.index.builder
Interface IndexBuilder

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultIndexBuilder
public interface IndexBuilder

Interface for building a Gene Expression Atlas index. Implementations should provide a way of setting the index location, which may be of a generic type to allow the index to be backed by a database, file system, or some other storage medium. IndexBuilder implementations should implement buildIndex() which contains the logic to construct the index.

By default, all genes and experiments are included, and all experiments (both pending and non-pending) are included.

If you are using an IndexBuilder in a standalone application (not a web application) and you do not want to reuse IndexBuilder for multiple index building calls, you should make sure you register a listener that performs a shutdown() upon completion. This will allow any resources being used by the IndexBuilder implementation to be reclaimed. Otherwise, an IndexBuilder instance may run indefinitely.

Author:
Tony Burdett

buildIndex

void buildIndex()
Build the index. This will build the index entirely from scratch. Use this if you wish to create or recreate the index with up-to-date information from the backing database.

Note that this method is not guaranteed to be synchronous, it only guarantees that the index has started building. Implementations are free to define their own multithreaded strategies for index construction. If you wish to be notified on completion, you should register a listener to get callback events when the build completes by using buildIndex(uk.ac.ebi.gxa.index.builder.listener.IndexBuilderListener). You can also use a listener to get at any errors that may have occurred during index building.

Calling this method is equivalent to calling buildIndex(null).

buildIndex

void buildIndex(IndexBuilderListener listener)
Build the index and register a listener that provides a callback on completion of the build task. This will build the index entirely from scratch. Use this if you wish to create or recreate the index with up-to-date information from the backing database.

Note that this method is not guaranteed to be synchronous, it only guarantees that the index has started building. Implementations are free to define their own multithreaded strategies for index construction.

The listener supplied will provide callbacks whenever the indexbuilder has interesting events to report.

Parameters:
listener - a listener that can be used to supply callbacks when building of the index completes, or when any errors occur.

registerIndexBuildEventHandler

void registerIndexBuildEventHandler(IndexBuilderEventHandler handler)
Register index update handler. Those handlers will be called when index build starts and finishes.

Parameters:
handler - handler to register

unregisterIndexBuildEventHandler

void unregisterIndexBuildEventHandler(IndexBuilderEventHandler handler)
Unregister index update handler. Handlers will not receive notifications anymore.

Parameters:
handler - handler to unregister
